intro: Satureja montana subsp. illyrica, commonly known as the Balkan savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and square stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are pink to purple, arranged in whorls along the stems, and it blooms from June to August. The leaves and flowers are used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb, valued for their pungent, aromatic flavor.
